intro: Solanum tenuiflorum, commonly known as the common nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its berries, which are toxic when ripe, are often mistaken for edible fruits. Solanum tenuiflorum is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
